Detailed Description

Internal base class for OBEX servers within applications.

This class offers a low-level, asynchronous interface to OBEX server functionality. It is therefore not intended for application usage as its interface might be subject to change.
For implementing custom OBEX-aware services, use the ObexDataServer interface instead, it provides a much higher level of abstraction.

When only simple object PUSH is required (no CONNECT with TARGET header), consider using ObexOppDataSinkPushServer, while the need for a directed connection will call for ObexDataServer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexServer::ObexServer (   ) 
 

Default constructor.

Default-constructed instances must be initialized using Init() before using them the first time.

ObexServer::ObexServer (  ExecutionContext *  ctx_ptr  ) 
 

Constructor. Constructs a usable object instance.

Intended to be used with dynamically allocated objects (new).

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context in which the server is to be run. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the current execution context. In the latter case, the current context must be valid at construction time.

ObexResult ObexServer::DataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  buffer,
BOOLEAN  proceed = FALSE
) 
 

Transfers ownership of a data buffer back to APOXI OBEX.

Must be invoked on any buffer which was delivered within a response after having processed the buffer content.

See also:
OnPut()

OnGet()

Parameters:
buffer ObexBuffer belonging to APOXI OBEX.
proceed Instructs APOXI OBEX to automatically send a continue response to proceed transferring data. Otherwise a call to ReturnResponse() would be required.

ObexServerId ObexServer::GetDefaultServerId (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the server id when no target is specified.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

UINT32 ObexServer::GetProgressInBytes (   )  const
 

Returns the cumulative progress in transferring data.

This method returns the amount of data already transferred for a pending PUT (inbound data) or GET (outbound data) operation. The final value is preserved even beyond completion of that operation, hence it is reset to '0' when a new operation is initiated.

Reimplemented in ObexDataServer.

ctx_ptr Execution context in which the server is to be run. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the current execution context. In the latter case, the current context must be valid when Init() is called.

Reimplemented from ObexServerDispatcher.

void ObexServer::OnAbort (  const ObexObject &  abort_req  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates that the server has accepted an incoming OBEX ABORT.

The default implementation of this method rejects the request as 'not implemented', therefore if you re-implement this method in your derived class, you should NEVER call Base::OnAbort() from your method !!!

Parameters:
abort_req OBEX object containing the ABORT headers.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

The default implementation of this method rejects the request as 'not implemented', therefore if you re-implement this method in your derived class, you should NEVER call Base::OnConnect() from your method !!!

void ObexServer::OnDataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  buffer  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Returns ownership of a buffer back to the application.

The passed data buffer had been produced by the application and may be now either recycled or disposed.

Parameters:
buffer ObexBuffer belonging to the application.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

void ObexServer::OnDisconnect (  const ObexObject &  disc_req  )  [protected, virtual]

The default implementation of this method rejects the request as 'not implemented', therefore if you re-implement this method in your derived class, you should NEVER call Base::OnDisconnect() from your method !!!

Parameters:
disc_req OBEX object containing the DISCONNECT headers.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

virtual void ObexServer::OnDisconnected (  ObexResult  result  )  [inline, protected, virtual]
 

Indicates that the current client has disconnected.

When the method is called, the client has (or has been) disconnected and the server should release any temporary resources and reset itself to a virgin state suitable for accepting a new client connection.

Parameters:
result ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' when the connection was disconnected using a proper OBEX DISCONNECT request, 'FALSE' when a spontaneous disconnection occured. Check the error code then to obtain more detailed information.

Reimplemented in ObexFtpDataServer.

void ObexServer::OnGet (  const ObexObject &  get_req,
BOOLEAN  initial
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates that the server has accepted an incoming OBEX GET.

The default implementation of this method rejects the request as 'not implemented', therefore if you re-implement this method in your derived class, you should NEVER call Base::OnGet() from your method !!! If the ObexObject contains BODY data (ObexObject::ObtainBuffer returns TRUE) don't forget to call DataProcessed() on the buffer when it is not needed anymore.

Parameters:
get_req OBEX object containing the GET headers and possibly even BODY data in an ObexBuffer.
initial 'TRUE' if a new GET operation is initiated by this request, 'FALSE' if an already ongoing operation is continued.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

void ObexServer::OnPut (  const ObexObject &  put_req,
BOOLEAN  initial
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates that the server has accepted an incoming OBEX PUT.

The default implementation of this method rejects the request as 'not implemented', therefore if you re-implement this method in your derived class, you should NEVER call Base::OnPut() from your method !!! If the ObexObject contains BODY data (ObexObject::ObtainBuffer returns TRUE) don't forget to call DataProcessed() on the buffer when it is not needed anymore.

Parameters:
put_req OBEX object containing the PUT headers and possibly BODY data in an ObexBuffer.
initial 'TRUE' if a new PUT operation is initiated by this request, 'FALSE' if an already ongoing operation is continued.

Reimplemented in ObexServerOppImpl.

ObexResult ObexServer::ReturnResponse (  const ObexObject &  obex_resp  ) 
 

Sends a response to a client.

Parameters:
obex_resp OBEX object containing the response headers, the response code and possibly BODY data in an ObexBuffer (most likely for a GET).
